messages.subject: floor washing
messages.msgSnippet: From: CelticFrau@aol.com Subject: Re: floor washing Thanks for the tip!  Is it Terra Cotta tile? ++++++++++++++++ It is not terra cotta, but one of those fake
messages.messageBody:
From: CelticFrau@...
Subject: Re: floor washing

Thanks for the tip! Is it Terra Cotta tile?

++++++++++++++++

It is not terra cotta, but one of those fake brands. It has a lot of in and
out coloring with a non-glaze surface. If you look across the room there is
no sheen to it at all.
Crystal

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] floor washing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/23/2006 1:54:12 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... hand-picked with no glaze.  The reason......no glaze  means you cannot see any dirt, animal
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/23/2006 1:54:12 PM Eastern Standard Time,
willowsfortress@... writes:

>>Wow. It looks like many are washing more than us. We have tile,
hand-picked with no glaze. The reason......no glaze means you cannot see
any dirt, animal spongy feet marks, etc. So, I vacuum the floor about 3
times per week (we live in NM...sand), but I only heat / steam mop about
twice per year. YEAH FOR NON-GLAZE TILE!!!! heehee
Crystal, David, and Sorscha<<

Thanks for the tip! Is it Terra Cotta tile?

Nancy B.




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: floor washing
messages.msgSnippet: ... ++++++++++++++++ Wow.  It looks like many are washing more than us.  We have tile, hand-picked with no glaze.  The reason......no glaze means you cannot
messages.messageBody:
> On Feb 21, 2006, at 7:33 AM, Arlynn Liebster wrote:
>
> > (just "washed" the
> > kitchen floor by throwing down a babywipe, stepping on it and
> > moving my foot
> > around over the dirty spots I didn't feel like looking at all day).
>
++++++++++++++++
Wow. It looks like many are washing more than us. We have tile,
hand-picked with no glaze. The reason......no glaze means you cannot see
any dirt, animal spongy feet marks, etc. So, I vacuum the floor about 3
times per week (we live in NM...sand), but I only heat / steam mop about
twice per year. YEAH FOR NON-GLAZE TILE!!!! heehee
Crystal, David, and Sorscha
